alert.note: Alert for Warren (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 30 at 4:11PM CDT until March 30 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Warren County in west central Mississippi... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Vicksburg. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is up to 1 inch per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vicksburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
